text:
A training programme on computerised registration of First Information Reports (FIRs) was held at the District Police Office here on Monday.

From April 15 onwards all police stations in the State would be registering FIRs digitally that would ultimately pave way for online transfer of FIR to courts. About 88 persons including Police Data Entry Operators, Station House Officers and writers attended the training. SP R. Ponni and Additional Superintendent of Police (Headquarters) M. Rangarajan participated. — Staff Reporter
title: Training in filing digital FIRs held
